greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n/gpf(n) + gpf(n) - 1, where gpf = A006530 = greatest prime factor.
comment: a(n) = A052126(n) + A006530(n) - 1; a(n) <= n and for n > 1: a(n) = n iff n is prime.
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..1000
mathematica: a[n_] := (g = FactorInteger[n][[-1, 1]]; n/g + g - 1); a /@ Range[2, 76] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 06 2011 *)
program: (PARI) gpf(n)= { local(f); f=factor(n)~; return(f[1, length(f)]) } { for (n=2, 1000, g=gpf(n); a=n / g + g - 1; write("b064920.txt", n, " ", a) ) } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Sep 29 2009
(PARI) a(n) = my(p = vecmax(factor(n)[,1])); n/p + p - 1; \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jun 19 2018
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 14 2001
